Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2011 09:52PM momof3sofar wrote: In addition to BC I also have MS and have had several MRI scans done, including one this afternoon... I have never asked nor been told to remove my rings and I have had 5 scans in the last year at 4 different locations.  I would think if they are gold it is ok.  I have a gold tooth cap in the back of my mouth as well and they have never been concerned about it. Dawn

I will be having a BMX on Wednesday and I have to be at the hospital at 6:30 am for a SNB dye injection at 7:30am.  Will I still be able to have him in the room until surgery time at 10?  Thanks so much for all your help. Dawn ~ Dawn Dx 9/13/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ? about SNB momof3sofar fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2010 11:28AM momof3sofar wrote: I agree, the next step is a more focused mammogram, they wait for the radiologist to actually look at the images while you are still there and then they may move to ultrasound and possibly a needle biopsy.  They tell you 2 hours because if you need all of those steps it could possibly take that long, if you get the all clear after the mammogram you are free to go after maybe 30-45 minutes.  Good luck
Posts.Title: What is involved in diagnostic testing? jenniferinchi LeahinTexas

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2010 01:41PM momof3sofar wrote: Thank you all sooo much for your responses!!!!!  I didn't think anything about it until he asked and then I got to wondering if I had to go somewhere for the shots and then wait there till surgery alone.  I do remember reading something about that creme in my paperwork before hand, I'll have to dig it out and see.  That is probably why I need to go an hour earlier than the SNB injections because I've already been preregistered and have talked to the surgery dept nurses about other meds I'm on and stuff.  It seemed a little odd to expect me to be there an hour earlier but if it is for the cream I'll all for it.  I will definately be calling on Monday but I knew I could get an answer faster from the "experts" here on the board. THANKS again! Dawn
Posts.Title: ? about SNB momof3sofar fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2010 05:38PM momof3sofar wrote: I am dealing with that myself right now.  I had a skin sparing mx with immediate diep reconstruction.  My diep flap died so it had to be removed.  I accidentally saw my breast while still in the hospital.  I say accidentally because I wasn't even thinking about it when I took off my gown to change clothes to go home and just stood up and there was me in all my glory in front of a mirror.  I agree with the almost threw up feeling!  It is all folded over with these little bubbles and the skin looks like an orange peel.  It was the scariest thing I've ever seen. I would suggest viewing photos of others who are fresh out of surgery to know you are NOT alone.  I will be getting an expander after I have healed (probably Feb) but until then I just cry because I was not prepared for what it would look like.  I had a breast one day and the next day I was in emergency surgery having it removed.  Since then I have seen other photos but it is still hard not being prepared. It will be ok, once you see others do look the same and it is normal but it is ok to be in denial for a little while!
Posts.Title: Anyone deal with an unattractive result by not ever looking? CrunchyPoodleMama barbe1958

Posts.Content: momof3sofar wrote: Hi everyone,  My name is Dawn and I'm a 43 yo mom to 3 great kiddos.  I was diagnosed with MS in Aug of 2009 which was the time of year when my mammo would have been scheduled so needless to say I was a little overwhelmed to think of a mammogram.  This August we were filling out the paperwork to start doing foster care and it requires a physical of coarse.  I saw the NP who is a dear friend of mine who was bugging me about getting my mammogram (she is a BC survivor so she pushes really hard) so I let them set up the appointment and this was my first digital one so the girl told me be prepared, they will probably call you back for another one. (my original one in 08 I had 2, US and core needle biopsy but all was fine)  I got my call back and wasn't worried, had the ultrasound and when the radiologist came in (another dear family friend, I could see his face and I knew it wasn't good)  He said, I am only going to US the left breast today, the right one has some microcalcifications that don't present in a benign way.  UGH, that was the beginning.  I had the sterostatic biopsy (or whatever it is called) and the result is DCIS grade 3, ER+, HER2 not back yet.  I underwent a MRI today to see if that is all we are dealing with.  I had blood drawn for the BRAC annalysis on friday but we are waiting to see if the insurance will pay for it.  My mom died of ovarian cancer 9 years ago.  I don't really know which way I'm leaning for surgery, but the closest radiation center is 45 miles away (and not the hospital that is doing my sugery that is 80 miles away) and if I have surgery in October 4-6 weeks of healing that puts me right in the middle of winter to drive, and close to the holidays when finished.  UGH, not to mention we only have 1 car so I'd have to get up at the crack of dawn to bring my dh to work then have to find a sitter for my 6 year old that I homeschool.  I hate that my choice may come down to convience.........  Of coarse all this may be mute if there is something else on the MRI or the BRAC test comes back positive.  Thanks for reading this far.  I feel like I'm talking in circles and have no idea what I'm saying. ~ Dawn Dx 9/13/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Another newbie waiting for results momof3sofar Lindy137

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2010 08:14AM momof3sofar wrote: Thanks Lindy.  I am hoping that I will have more answers by the end of the week about what I am dealing with so I can make the decision soon.  I didn't even imagine that I could get surgery quickly, my assumption was it was going to take weeks.  I guess I shouldn't assume anything. I have done so much reading in the last few days that every page or website I'm convinced that is that I'm going to do until I get to the next one and THAT is what I'm going to do.  I feel like I should just put my options in a hat and pull one out.  If it is truely "just" DCIS no matter what I choose the eventual outcome is said to be the same.  SIGH
Posts.Title: Another newbie waiting for results momof3sofar Lindy137

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2010 07:15PM momof3sofar wrote: I had something very similar happen to me a couple years ago.  It ended up being a sebacious cyst that became inflamed and then infected.  It was not there one day and then by the end of the week it was huge, unfortunately it became VERY infected and did not respond to antibiotics and they were even testing me for MRSA.  It is painful but harmless.  Hopefully that is all yours is too.  I even had a friend comment that it looked like I was growing a 3rd boob (because it was more centered in my chest area) Don't panic until after the biopsy, and truely not even then.  The waiting is definately the hardest part of all this!!!
Posts.Title: Can a cancerous tumor grow quickly within a week? Ling29 Ling29

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2010 03:53PM momof3sofar wrote: Thank you so much ladies!  So the results of the MRI are back.  The side with the DCIS appears to be just that, DCIS nothing further was noted on the report.  The left side however has areas that light up with the contrast images.  I do know that I have cysts on that side, had that ultrasounded when I got my screening mammogram.  The coordinator told me that it could be just from where I am in my cycle but they need to dot all their I's and cross all their T's.  I don't know what to even begin to think about this latest developement.
Posts.Title: Another newbie waiting for results momof3sofar Lindy137

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2010 10:13AM momof3sofar wrote: I am so sorry that things didn't turn out to be B9 as we had all hoped (especially you) I have to say I agree with everyone else who says to at least send your test results out for a second opinon.  You wouldn't need to be physcially there so it could be done immeadiately while you plan your surgery locally.  You can always cancel it if someone else finds a more definitive answer for you!  Dawn
Posts.Title: Can a cancerous tumor grow quickly within a week? Ling29 Ling29

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2010 08:31PM momof3sofar wrote: I agree, there is fast growing and then there is what happened to you!  The good news is the doctors are taking this serious and you will be moving to the next step quickly and not waiting weeks!  Maybe the antibiotics will show some improvement and you can breath easier.  My sebacious cyst was huge as it swelled but now that the infection is gone it is about the size of a dime so while it will need to come out someday it will not leave me with any physcial scarring.  They tried to remove it during my MX but it was just a little too high to mess with at the time.  If the antibiotics do take the swelling down don't let them do surgery until everything is settled! And hug that DH really tight, he is a keeper for sure!
Posts.Title: Can a cancerous tumor grow quickly within a week? Ling29 Ling29

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2010 03:46AM momof3sofar wrote: As someone who is just 12 days out from my BMX I will say the things I have found to be invaluable to me so far have been the recliner for sleeping (I had a free tram/DIEP combo reconstruction so standing from a laying position is hard)   The most helpful thing though has been a notebook for me to just write down what meds I took and the time.  You think you'll remember but throw in a nap or a visitor or just pain coming back sooner rather than later and you will quickly forget what you took when.  It is easier for me to have a cami with drain pouches than to keep pinning them up to my clothes.  I have a busy 6 year old and she sees me standing up and expects me to come see everything she's been working on while I was sitting down but if I am spending 15 minutes pinning and unpinning drains it upsets her.  I know it's a little thing but you did mention having small kids. I do have 4 drains though so that makes a little difference, I'm not sure how many someone with TE would get. Good luck with your upcoming surgery, soon it will be behind you and you can concentrate on the next phase of your journey in life.
Posts.Title: What To Do To Prep for Surgery Recovery Petrochick orchidgal

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 08:33PM momof3sofar wrote: Good for you Cathi for hanging tough! I'm sorry your DH is sick and that his team lost...double bummer for him!  I think one reason young parents now do not have a lot of structure for their kids is they don't want to be the parent, they want to be the friend.  They don't want to see kids get upset or have to say no so they just don't.  What they don't realize is that kids NEED structure and boundries to not become little terrors.  That their lives would be easier if they would just set up those boundries.  I've done daycare for years and that was my biggest pet peeve.  It would always be a rough monday but by the time the left they remembered where they were and what they could get away with and by tuesday they'd cry when mom would pick them up not at drop off.  Dawn
Posts.Title: please help sueps barbe1958

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2010 05:40PM momof3sofar wrote: I've been following this for a while now and though I don't know you, I am a parent to 2 "adults" and am in the process of becoming a foster parent so I have a lot of empathy for your situation. EVERYTHING everyone is telling you is sooo true.  Time for tough love.  The BEST thing you can do is unplug your phone when the kids are gone so that any begging for money or diapers is recorded, same with FB and Emails.  Keep a record of things so you can just turn that over to the SW.  It will not be just grandma's story over moms, it will be a hard copy of what the TRUE picture for those children is.  It is horrible that the kids will be stuck in the middle of this, but permanancy is what those kids need and just staying with you is not it.  I will say a prayer for you guys, this is NOT an easy road to take and it's got to be even harder when it is your family that is involved.  Are you a member of the Adoption. com fostercare forum?  There are a lot of people over there who are in similar situations, it might be worth it to check it out! HUGE CYBER HUGS!! Dawn
Posts.Title: please help sueps barbe1958

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 09:54PM momof3sofar wrote: First, let me just say, those baby shots are WAY TOO CUTE, what blessings they must be in your life!!! Cathi, that's so funny (in a not so funny kind of way) that SIL threatened to talk to the school if you don't.  Ummm isn't that part of being a parent? Wow I don't know how you do it some days, My eyes roll around in my head just reading some of it.  Hang tough, you are doing great!

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 02:22PM momof3sofar wrote: But police charges will mean they are not capable of caring for the kids yet.  It's better than letting them be out with the kids in the car and getting pulled over and arrested and then the kids going into foster care while they look for relatives.  It's just so sad all the way around.
Posts.Title: please help sueps barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2011 06:14PM momof3sofar wrote: HANG TOUGH!!!  I know it is breaking your heart to think of the kids not eating well and your DD being broke again but this is where you HAVE to stay the course!!!!  The kids will not be harmed by a few days of eating junk.  No it is not a good thing but it is time for DD to start making better choices and at least the kids DID eat.  The school will watch to make sure they have food for lunch as well.  Please, Please just let this play out and feed the kids lots of healthy foods when they get home.  HUGS, I can't imagine how hard this must be for you!!! Dawn
Posts.Title: please help sueps barbe1958

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 02:12PM momof3sofar wrote: Oh man, what a mess.  I just don't understand (as does anyone with half a brain) why they are sending the kids home BEFORE the plan is completed!!!!  The idea of a plan is to work it on your own and THEN get your kids back.  I'm so sorry your grandkids are put in the middle of it.  I will be praying that the GAL suggests to at least wait until all the checks come back before letting them go home.  I'd also see if there was anyway to "see" her driving without a license and report it to the police and let them handle that.  WHAT A MESS. At this point all anyone can do is pray that the BEST for the kids is what happens in the end and they are not hurt in anyway (emotionally or physically) while waiting for that to happen. More cyber hugs!

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 05:25PM momof3sofar wrote: Oh man, don't get me started on the pagents. LOL  Now in defense of the show the type of pagent they are showing is called a glitz pagent so it is NOT the type of thing the next miss america will come from. LOL  It is a specific type of venue that is all about the over the top stuff.  We are NOT into any type of that stuff, I don't even like it when we have to over do the makeup for EmmaLi's dance recitals but there are plenty of pagents that are not over the top like that show.  EmmaLi does like to watch the show but gets upset with the girls who throw fits, she is such a good kid and can't understand why everyone isn't...that includes her friends. :) Way to go on your comment about the groceries!!!!! 300.00 would buy a TON of potatos, roasts, cereal, milk, bread etc.  UGH  I know how frustrating that must be.  Wasn't that car just broke down recently...If they have to put money into it I'd say a smart thing would be save that 300 for future repairs but I know that would never happen either. LOL  SIGH Hang in there!!!

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 10:18PM momof3sofar wrote: LOL, I LOVE that toothless grin too!  EmmaLi has her first top tooth that's wiggly and the second one is starting too, she's going to have a hard time eating corn on the cob this summer. LOL Thanks for the compliment on her name too Cathi, she was adopted from China so we mixed the east and west with Emma and Li (which means beautiful and we certainly think she is) to get EmmaLi.
